tourName: Short break kayaking holiday in Sweden
generalInfo:
The remote Saint Anna Archipelago on the East Coast of Sweden is heaven for kayakers. Nowhere in Europe can you find 6000 islands so closely clustered together - a maze from the forested sheltered islands close to the mainland out to the barren islets bordering the open sea. You are free to paddle and wild camp wherever you like!

This is a self-guided long weekend and you decide your own route. All top-notch equipment is provided along with a detailed guide book, and 24/7 support while kayaking. Your pre-ordered groceries are packed when you arrive, and after a briefing on safety, navigation and the area, you're ready to hit the water!

Saint Anna boasts one of Sweden's highest number of sunny days with some of the warmest temperatures in the sea. Almost all the islands are uninhabited, but the area also has a rich history of people living their whole lives out here. It’s completely your choice what to explore – visit cultural points of interest, do all wilderness, or more likely, a blend of both!

One suggested itinerary would take you to Kupa Klint, the famous lookout with a spectacular view of the hundreds of islets below. Harstena, the idyllic village seemingly frozen in time, is a great place to stroll, enjoy traditional archipelago cuisine at the restaurant or heavenly cinnamon swirls from the bakery.

Along the way you’ll pass fantastic bird sanctuaries. As many as thirty-five coastal species breed here, including White-tailed eagles, Ospreys, Arctic skuas, Razorbills and Guillemots. There are regular sightings of Grey seals bobbing their heads above the water while hunting for fish. It's all up to you how relaxed or hard you make your route, and daily weather reports from the base help you plan your itinerary.

A perfect tour for beginners or experienced sea kayakers alike!

dayInfo.description: Into the maze. All your provided gear and pre-ordered groceries are waiting for you at the launch. We'll do a briefing on navigation, safety and the area, and go through a rough plan for your expedition. You'll repack your clothes into drybags and load the kayaks. Using our top-of-the-line equipment is a real treat! It can be hard to justify purchasing gear of that caliber on your own! Our launch site is situated in a sheltered bay – soon you round the first islands and see a maze of islands spreading out in all directions. During your paddle northeast towards Aspöja you’ll pass through many clusters of forested islands and islets. A variety of different ducks, as well as swans and Grey herons breed around here, and White-tailed eagles are sighted regularly since they nest in large trees nearby. Continue paddling through the Uggelholmarna Nature Reserve, a great spot for a break. Three hundred year-old pine and linden trees grow here, and the open forest is perfect for a short wander. Aim east towards the narrow inlet between Lammskär and Kalvskär - you'll end up surrounded by a beautiful and sheltered atoll formation of islands. Sunset views here are amazing!

A band of islets against the horizon. Your following morning passes bird sanctuaries with lots of birdlife, if you choose you can paddle towards Äspskär. This crescent-shaped smooth islet is surrounded by shallow waters, and is superb for swimming and even snorkelling! Another absolutely stunning route goes through a massive cluster of hundreds of barren islets close to the open sea. This is the most finely-chiselled archipelago that exists in Sweden, and the paddle is so beautiful with the blue horizon as your backdrop. You may spot Ospreys, Great Cormorants and Arctic skuas along with many other types of birds. Grey seal sightings are frequent around Norrbådarna and Ådskär. Continue towards one of the most famous points of interest in Saint Anna - the old navigation mark Kupa Klint. It’s a fantastic lookout with spectacular views of the archipelago spreading out below. Inside the outer band of skerries you find the large island Missjö with its parallel islands. There is a rustic pub on Missjö run by local boat taxi man and sea dog Mats. He's often there to host and tell stories and it's a very fun time indeed!

The village that time forgot. Steer your kayak south towards the most visited island in the area – Harstena. An idyllic view of the village greets you as you paddle the narrow inlet. Harstena is famous far and wide for its picturesque and historic beauty. Learn more about the history of the village at the museum in the old school, munch on delicious cinnamon swirls from the bakery and treat yourself to a meal of delicious archipelago cuisine at the water-side restaurant. A short paddle west takes you to Torrön and its mosaic of surrounding islets. It’s a very beautiful sheltered area with shallow waters, smooth rocks and calm creeks – great for swimming and sunbathing. Make sure to look down as you glide through the myriad of skerries to view the bladder wrack forests on the rocky bottoms.

Land ahoy! Your last day in this island wonderland! Enjoy a leisurely morning and jump in the water for a final dip. Cook up a hearty breakfast in preparation for a somewhat strenuous paddle ahead. Head north across some pretty exposed waters until you reach the pretty narrow passage between Missjö and its inner parallel island. A quick paddle west and you reach the bustling mainland hub Tyrislöt. Take some extra time here to visit the Archipelago Museum and stroll the nature trail. Down a couple of cold lagers among the cherry trees outside the countryside pub. A great way to end your weekend of wilderness and archipelago culture! A pad on the back is in order, you just completed an impressive kayaking expedition all by yourselves in a truly wild coastal landscape!

tourName: Winter ski touring in Sweden holiday
generalInfo:
A silent snow-clad landscape of forests, mires and fells, the air so crisp, the light so icy blue. Cross-country skiing over untouched snow is a magical winter experience.

Ski touring is a perfect winter activity for beginners, it’s pretty much like hiking but on skis! We start off on lower altitudes in the remote forested valley where we stay, and across frozen mires close by. Ideal locations for your first steps on cross-country skis.

During the week, we practice our skiing skills and familiarity with zubzero temps towards one or two nights winter camping on a mountain plateau. We strap on sleds with everything we need to stay happy, warm & fed, and head out for a true winter expedition!

Our base for the week is charming grand cabin on the banks of lake Navar in the Dalarna region of Sweden. It's located in a remote valley, completely surrounded by tall wooded hills. The cabin is off-grid and rustic, with a lovely cosy atmosphere. Wood-fired heaters will keep us warm. Lanterns and candles give us light. A sauna and melted snow is our “bath”. And a wild magical winter landscape right on our doorstep.

This is a 7-day tour with pickup and dropoff times adapted so that you can fly in on the first day and fly out on the last day.

dayInfo.description: INTO THE DEEP FORESTS OF NORTHERN DALARNA After about an hour's drive from the train station, we arrive at a remote valley completely surrounded by tall wooded hills. Here we find the beautiful lake Navar. On the banks of the lake is the grand cabin and sauna that will be our base for the week. The Navar valley is located northwest of Mora in the Dalarna region. We are in the land of boreal forests, mountains, lakes, mires and folklore. This is the part of Sweden we have in our minds eye when thinking of a time long gone, where many of our traditions have their roots. We spend the first evening enjoying dinner together and just getting to know each other.

THE RÄNNKÖLEN MIRES Rännkölen is a stunning open landscape of snow-covered frozen mires and sparse trees, surrounded by deep boreal forests with tall ancient pines. It’s an ideal area for our first steps on touring skis with small variations in altitude and actual tracks to follow. We filled our thermoses with coffee and tea this morning, packed some firewood, and find somewhere along the tracks to grill sandwiches on the fire along with a warming cup of soup. Down in the valley after our skiing trip, we take a stroll around the Ribbåsen “Fäbodar”. They are small log houses, where farmers used to bring their cattle for grazing. Farmhands would stay in these little cottages all summer long, and most of them date back to the 1700s. A whole culture emerged from this way of life with cooking traditions, superstitions and folk music. This region is famous for these idyllic settings and their cultural heritage.

ANJOSVARDEN NATURE RESERVE We drive further north to the Anjosvarden nature reserve, a true wilderness, that is sometimes called Sweden’s most southern alpine mountain peak. In truth, it’s not really classified as such, but rather a fell with a high enough altitude to lack trees, the highest point is 764 m.a.s.l. Our journey towards the peak offers some steeper inclines, but mostly quite flat terrain over frozen mires. Mother nature offers up many types of snow. Maybe the crust is hard enough to tread on top, maybe the snow is powdery and deep. Perhaps the wind has created beautiful ripples across the snowy expanses. Either way, our touring skis are perfect for moving slowly through this amazing white landscape. Along the way we’ll pass low lonely trees completely covered in snow. They create fantasmic shapes and forms often depicted in photographs from this wild and unique nature reserve. Once at the top we enjoy soup pre-prepared by our wilderness chef at the log shelter. If the weather is clear, we get a beautiful view of the Transtrand and Fulufjället mountains to the west.

WINTER EXPEDITION IN FULUFJÄLLET NATIONAL PARK This is what we've been working our skills towards! A 2-night expedition up the Fulufjället mountain plateau, close to the Norwegian border. The skis have built-in 'skins' which give them a good grip when going uphill. After the initial ascent, we'll spend a couple of hours skiing across the vast alpine plateau. These are true alpine conditions, white as far as the eye can see, no trees, and an amazing vista of the lowlands spreading out below. By late afternoon it’s time to set up camp, cook dinner and simply enjoy this amazing place. The solitude up here and the sounds of the wind sweeping across the plains are hard to describe in words. You’ll spend the night either in a tent, or if you’re keen, a bivouac of your own making. Each group member will pull a small sled with all the gear needed to comfortably stay for two nights outdoors in subzero temperatures. The next morning we'll leave our camp behind and head off on a day trip. We may ski to the “altar ring”, an ancient monument that’s considered Sweden’s highest altar of worship. It was likely built by the Sámi, who have inhabited this area for thousands of years. Darkness falls early this time of year, and we’ll be back at camp by the afternoon. We’ll spend the evening together in a yurt, where we can all hang out, cook dinner, and do some wood carving, protected from the elements. One of the many amazing properties of snow is that you can dig and form your own structures. By digging a canal for your legs, voilà, we got ourselves a couch and a table! Light up some lanterns and candles, put down some sheep skins and we have a cosy living room on the snowy wind-swept plateau. We’ll take our time descending to the valley, downhill is indeed the trickier part of tour skiing. It's then a 2 hour drive back to the base cabin at lake Navar. Exhausted but full of a feeling of accomplishment, we enjoy a final dinner and a last sauna together.
HOMEWARD BOUND The last morning in this Swedish winter paradise. We head back to Mora train station by noon, so that you have time to catch a flight home in the evening.

generalInfo: Embrace adventure and unique wonder on an eight-day Sweden tour that whisks you into Lapland’s natural grandeur. Enjoy a hot-air balloon ride over the white landscape, spend time in a wellness oasis, and relax in the heart of Swedish Lapland’s alluring seasons. Designed to immerse you in the highlights of the country’s far north, chase the Northern Lights or bask in the splendor of winter during your Lapland experience.

dayInfo.title: Stockholm - Welcome to Beautiful Sweden
dayInfo.description: Stockholm is a city of history and charm, where cafes and authentic restaurants provide a glimpse of where past and present culture converge. Upon your arrival at Stockholm Arlanda Airport, your private transfer will meet you at customs and escort you to the comforts of your luxury accommodations, where you will have the remainder of the day at your leisure. For a great introduction to the city, enjoy a boat tour through the waterways that weave through the cityscape for views of the alluring archipelago and the artistic bridges of Stockholm.

dayInfo.title: Stockholm - Embrace the Charms of Stockholm
dayInfo.description: The day is yours to explore the character of Sweden’s capital city and immerse yourself in the culture, beauty, and traditions that filter through the museums and streets. A guided tour can take you through the colorful facades of Old Town, where the narrow cobbled lanes date back to the 13th century. You may find the aromas of glogg and spiced cookies in winter, before you visit the world-renowned Vasa Museum, where the region’s seafaring past comes to life. Witness the 17th-century pride of the Swedish Imperial fleet as it sheds new light on the wonders of the city.

dayInfo.title: Lapland - Scenic Forest Drive and Hot-Air Balloon Ride
dayInfo.description: In the morning you will travel north for a unique experience in a luxury Lapland safari camp. The scenic drive in winter demonstrates the seasonal wonderland of snow that blankets the forest and the Rane River Valley. You may spot moose or deer foraging along the treeline as you settle into the comforts of your stunning accommodations. In the evening you will float into the sky on a hot-air balloon ride for an unparalleled view of the Northern Lights dancing across the sky, far from the light pollution of the southern cities.

dayInfo.title: Lapland - Indulge in a Winter Wilderness Adventure
dayInfo.description: The day is yours to explore the Laplands as you prefer, from fat bikes to snowshoes, Nordic skis to a sauna beside the frozen lakeshores. Travel along the icy waters of the Rane River Valley or weave between the trees of the snowcapped forest on Nordic skis, where designated tracks can help you easily navigate the wilderness. You may view herds of reindeer enjoying the serene ambiance of their surroundings as you glide through the majesty of nature far from the bustling pace of city life. When you return from your excursion, you can lounge in the sauna and relax your muscles.

dayInfo.title: Lapland - Enjoy a Dog-Sled Excursion and Transfer
dayInfo.description: In the morning you can venture back out into the wilderness on a dog-sledding adventure to learn more about the skills it takes to travel through the snowscape. In the quiet, you may hear the huskies crunch the snow beneath their paws as they add quick movement to the forest’s stillness. You will leave behind the treasures of the wilderness experience and transfer to luxury cabin accommodations above still waters and connected to the shore by a floating walkway. For an introduction to the calmness of the area, you can enjoy a relaxing sauna.

dayInfo.title: Jokkmokk - Find Wellness and the Sami Community
dayInfo.description: Your Sami guide will meet you in the morning and introduce you to the greater ethnic community that represents one of the oldest living civilizations in Europe. They may share their vast knowledge of reindeer as you visit the herd, before sitting around a fire in a traditional tent house, listening to traditional songs. The warm invitation into the community will reveal continued customs, such as a three-course meal with local ingredients prepared over an open fire. You may have the opportunity to cross into the Arctic Circle and get close to a reindeer herd to feed the animals.

dayInfo.title: Jokkmokk - Revel in Lapland’s Beauty at Your Leisure
dayInfo.description: The day is at your leisure to enjoy the diverse possibilities of a Lapland adventure. Venture onto the water for a kayaking excursion or enjoy a quiet ice-fishing opportunity. You can also partake in the celebrated spa for a relaxing treatment that can soothe your muscles or immerse you in the tradition of a spa ritual that transitions between a cold bath and sauna experience, resulting in ultimate relaxation. Embrace the seclusion of your accommodations and enjoy the beauty of surrounding nature the way you wish to.

dayInfo.title: Jokkmokk - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning you may find the aromas of cedar from the saunas or lingering scents of homemade bread and butter in the restaurant at breakfast. The Lapland embodies the last remaining wilderness of Northern Europe and captures the wild wonders and alluring spirit of Swedish cultural heritage, from contemporary culture to traditional communities. After breakfast you will travel to the Lulea Airport to begin your journey home, bringing an end to your unforgettable adventures in Swedish Lapland.

placesVisited: Stockholm, Vilhelmina, Slussfors, Swedish Lapland, Vindelfjallens Nature Reserve
generalInfo: Silence, serenity, and solitude abound in Swedish Lapland, a white wilderness where the aurora dances and the huskies just keep on running for this 8-day vacation. On a dog sledding safari, explore lands that human eyes rarely see, crossing frozen lakes and ancient forests enveloped in snow. Get away and discover a fairytale world where yours are the only marks in the snow.

dayInfo.title: Stockholm – Sweden’s Charming Capital
dayInfo.description: Stockholm is a capital city with the atmosphere of a small town. You will stay in Gamla Stan, the old town on an island in the heart of the city. Cobblestone streets take you on a journey past narrow townhouses, each of them painted a different hue. This is Scandinavia from the middle ages with contemporary indulgences all around. With lantern-lit cafes, cozy fine dining restaurants, market squares running alongside waterways, settle in and begin to explore.

dayInfo.title: Stockholm – Amid Waterways and Museums
dayInfo.description: Today gives you space to overcome any travel fatigue before you head out into the land of the huskies. Stockholm is a city of waterways and cobbles, and if anywhere can make you feel relaxed, it is here, especially when coffee aromas float down the lanes. You could visit the ABBA Museum or the Nobel Museum during the day, go on a Nordic food tour, or perhaps a brunch cruise on Stromma. The day is yours to enjoy.

dayInfo.title: Slussfors – Into the Wild Landscape of Swedish Lapland
dayInfo.description: Fly north and land in the remoteness of Swedish Lapland as nothing breaks the journey to Slussfors and Vindelfjallens Nature Reserve. You will be welcomed with a bunch of Swedish waffles and check into a lakeside guesthouse. Learn how to pack the sled and the best way to pack your own luggage in the waterproof hold-all. Get a lesson in driving the sled and learn the hand signals required to control the huskies. Then take a ride, a first real exploration of Swedish Lapland – there’s so much more to come tomorrow.

dayInfo.title: Swedish Lapland – First Day of the Husky Safari
dayInfo.description: Soon the wooden huts recede into the horizon, and there is nothing but you and the huskies. Between forests and mountains, you ride with icy water all around with a sense of solitude. Arrive at the cabin and take care of the dogs, and once they are sorted, build a fire and help slow cook a traditional Lappish meal. This first day may be moose and potatoes cooked on an outdoor muurikka, a skillet-style pan you place over an open fire highlighting a chance to connect further with the journey and the husky dogs.

dayInfo.title: Swedish Lapland – Dogsledding Through the Wilderness
dayInfo.description: The colors of dawn stretch for two hours, with the pinks and oranges reflecting off the snow. The sun rises at its own pace, and you depart with it. Harness the huskies, pack the sled, then drive through magical mountain landscapes. A part of the world rarely seen by humans, create new paths in the virgin snow. Arrive at your cozy wooden cabin in the afternoon for a comfortable base in the middle of a nature reserve. The aurora borealis dances overhead, the huskies stand like sentinels, and nature creates a humbling silence.

dayInfo.title: Slussfors – Traversing Frozen Lakes and Ancient Spruce Forests
dayInfo.description: By now, you will know the dogs and their personalities. Some come to greet you in the morning, some are natural leaders, and others have histories that your guide has shared. At first glance, this landscape can seem monotonous, but after four days of dogsledding, you realize this is a real adventure. There’s always another perspective, still something new to pass in Lapland. As Slussfors draws near, the dogs run faster, sensing their home is on the horizon. Like other evenings, you eat heart-warming traditional food and have a chance to dip in the sauna before looking for the aurora.

dayInfo.title: Stockholm – Snowmobile Safari and Sami History
dayInfo.description: There’s a different way to explore today. Travel to Vilhelmina and store your luggage at a trusted hotel. Snowmobiles aren’t as charming as huskies, but they can cover large distances and are always fun to handle. Head out on snowmobiles with your guide, riding into the land you haven’t explored before to meet a small Sami community and discuss the subtleties of their heritage. From reindeer to snowmobiles to crafting a living from the snow and ice, stories and history abound. Return to Vilhelmina before your early evening flight back to Stockholm and a final night in Sweden.

dayInfo.title: Stockholm – Departure
dayInfo.description: The wilderness may be behind you, but memories of the wild live on. You may already be missing Lapland, but the land will still be part of you. Multi-day dogsledding is an experience that can have a profound effect on your connection with nature. After a free day in Stockholm, you will be transferred to the airport for your outbound flight.
